questions.question: A 'parking lane' as defined in the Basic Licence Driver's Handbook is:

answers.text: A lane closest to the curb, where parking is permitted but there are no meters
All of these responses are correct
That portion of a primary highway between the edge of the roadway to the right of the direction of traffic and the nearest solid white line, not being the centre line, marked on the roadway
A lane immediately beside a row of parking meters in an urban area

questions.question: The emergency stopping lane (or the shoulder) on the side of the highway is there for:

answers.text: slow-moving vehicles
drivers who have problems with their vehicle
to drive in so another vehicle can pass you more easily
for wide-load vehicles only

questions.question: When recovering from a skid, a driver should:

answers.text: Accelerate and steer in the opposite direction of the skid
Brake and counter-steer
Steer in the direction the driver wants the front of the vehicle to go
Brake and hold firmly on the steering wheel

questions.question: A 'Weave Zone' is best described as:

answers.text: A place on a highway where the entrance and exit lanes are close together, and vehicles that are slowing to exit the highway must drive between vehicles that are accelerating to enter the highway
An area on the highway that is used for emergency parking
A place where the highway has a series of curves that require the driver to slow down
A limited access area on a highway where a driver can legally back their vehicle when they miss their exit

questions.question: A driver entering a traffic circle:

answers.text: Must yield to traffic on the right
Must yield to vehicles in the traffic circle
Has the right-of-way
Must use the courtesy rule and yield to the vehicle that arrived first

questions.question: When you arrive at a traffic circle, you should:

answers.text: Slow down as you approach the circle
yield to traffic already in the circle
yield to pedestrians
all of the above

questions.question: A deceleration lane is:

answers.text: A lane where vehicles reduce speed when exiting a highway
The right lane of a four-lane highway for use by slower moving vehicles
The lane immediately to the right of a solid yellow line on a highway
A lane on hills for use by slower moving vehicles

questions.question: When you’re exiting from a highway, when should you start to slow down?

answers.text: before reaching the deceleration lane
after entering the deceleration lane
when there’s traffic behind you
before turning on your turn signal

questions.question: When turning left from a two-way road onto a one-way road, what lane should the vehicle enter?

answers.text: The lane immediately to the right of centre
The lane nearest the curb on the left side of the one-way road
The centre lane of the one-way road
The right lane of the one-way road

questions.question: When two vehicles approach an uncontrolled 'T' intersection at right angles to each other at approximately the same time:

answers.text: The vehicle on the left must yield the right-of-way
The vehicle on the left has the right-of-way
The vehicle going straight through always has the right-of-way
Both vehicles must stop

questions.question: Unless otherwise permitted, what lane must a driver be in to turn left from a one-way road?

answers.text: The lane to the right of centre
The left lane nearest the left curb
The lane closest to the right curb
The centre lane

questions.question: An acceleration lane is:

answers.text: A lane with broken line markings
A lane on hills, designated for faster moving vehicles
The left lane of a four-lane highway, for use when passing slow moving vehicles
A lane in a merge area for use by vehicles entering the highway

questions.question: When driving in the right lane on a highway, what should a driver do if another vehicle attempts to merge from an acceleration lane on the right?

answers.text: Stop to allow the other vehicle in
Accelerate to close any gap in the traffic flow
Move into the left lane if it is safe to do so, or be prepared to adjust speed
Insist that the other vehicle yield the right-of-way

questions.question: When approaching the top of a hill on a two-lane highway:

answers.text: Exceeding the speed limit is permitted
Flash the headlights to warn oncoming vehicles
Stay to the right portion of the lane
Keep close to the centre line to prevent others from passing

questions.question: At what minimum distance must headlights be dimmed at night when approaching another vehicle from behind?

answers.text: 60 metres
300 metres
150 metres
100 metres

questions.question: When are dual turns permitted at an intersection?

answers.text: Only when turning from a one-way road onto a one-way road
Only when indicated by pavement markings or traffic control signs
Any time there are at least 2 lanes on the road being entered
Only when the road has 6 or more lanes

questions.question: An 'uncontrolled intersection':

answers.text: Has a flashing yellow light for one direction of traffic and a flashing red light for the other direction of traffic
Has traffic signs but no traffic control signal lights
Has no traffic control signal lights or traffic signs
Has Yield signs but no Stop signs

questions.question: When facing a Merge sign a driver should:

answers.text: Stop at the entrance to the other highway and wait until a gap in traffic occurs before proceeding
Watch for a gap in traffic on the highway they are entering, adjust to highway speed in the acceleration lane and blend in smoothly
Stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic already on the highway
Reduce speed and proceed with caution

questions.question: The recommended method for travelling through a curve on a highway is:

answers.text: Reduce speed before the curve, stay in the lane and gently accelerate after entering the curve
Maintain speed before the curve, brake in the curve, look ahead and accelerate out of the curve
Cover the brake pedal before the curve, counter-steer toward the outside of the lane and accelerate when exiting
Accelerate before the curve, cover the brake pedal in the curve and accelerate after leaving the curve

questions.question: When should you never pass in the oncoming lane?

answers.text: on a curve
near or at the crest of a hill
in an intersection
all of the above

questions.question: What’s the first thing you should do when you want to change lanes?

answers.text: complete both shoulder and mirror checks
slow down
check the speed signs
accelerate

questions.question: U-turns in urban areas are not permitted at:

answers.text: An intersection with marked traffic lanes
Roads with a landscaped median
An intersection controlled by a traffic control signal
An intersection controlled by Stop signs

questions.question: A U-turn isn’t allowed:

answers.text: on a curve
near or at the crest of a hill
where you see a sign that prohibits a U-turn
All of the above

questions.question: On a multi-lane highway, which lane should you drive in if you’re moving slow:

answers.text: the middle traffic lane
the far-right lane
the left traffic lane
the shoulder of the road

questions.question: You should be in the proper lane at least ____ before turning at an intersection.

answers.text: 15 metres
20 metres
10 metres
25 metres

questions.question: What kind of line on the road means you’re allowed to change lanes?

answers.text: a solid yellow line
a broken white line
a double-solid yellow line
a double-solid white line

questions.question: What you can’t see in your vehicle’s rear and side-view mirrors is your:

answers.text: dark area
danger zone
blind spot
all of the above
